alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Towns; Union (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 3:26AM EDT until August 29 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL FANNIN, CENTRAL UNION AND WEST CENTRAL TOWNS COUNTIES... At 326 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blairsville, Young Harris, Owltown, Jones Creek, Gaddistown, Margret, Track Rock, Gumlog, Hawk Mountain Shelter and Dial. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
